Title: Facebook Analytics on Building Trust for E-Commerce in Indonesia - A study of Shopee and Tokopedia
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ibrahim, I.I., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Huda, C., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Social media is a term used to describe a collection of popular platforms to contribute and share information. Growth in the use of social media is forcing companies to use social media as their marketing tools to enhance relationships with consumers and to create brand awareness. The authors observed how e-commerce websites in Indonesia benefit from the use of social media for their business, focusing on the correlations of the Facebook content posted by the two top e-commerce sites in Indonesia - Shopee and Tokopedia - to build trust among consumers. Linear regression analysis was used to determine the impact of the content posted by the company, and the number of comments and likes. For the purposes of this study, 'number of shares' was used as a proxy for trust. The results of the analysis showed a significant impact among trust, posts, comments, and likes. At the end of the study we made a social media share software application design with a Waterfall design method and object-oriented programming concept. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: facebook; shopee; social media; social media analytics; tokopedia
Index Keywords: Application programs; Electronic commerce; Information management; Object oriented programming; Regression analysis; Facebook; shopee; Social media; Social media analytics; tokopedia; Social networking (online)
